qas.question: What do dogs represent to Christians?
Jewish law dictates that anyone owning a dog must feed the dog before who?
If a Jewish person owns a dog, he must do what to do the dog before he does it to himself?
What does a dog represent in the Christian culture?

context: Jewish law does not prohibit keeping dogs and other pets. Jewish law requires Jews to <a2_0>feed<a2_0/> dogs (and other animals that they own) before <a1_0>themselves<a1_0/>, and make arrangements for feeding them before obtaining them. In Christianity, dogs represent <a0_0><a3_0>faithfulness<a3_0/>.
